description: Comoros is establishing a curfew, starting April 25th, from 8:00 p.m. to 5:00 a.m. throughout the national territory.

description: Comoros has updated their curfew. The original curfew, established on April 25th, was in place from 8pm to 5 am each night. The relaxed curfew, established July 8th, is in place from 11pm to 5am each night.

Comoros has updated their curfew. The original curfew, established on April 25th, was in place from 8pm to 5 am each night. The relaxed curfew, established July 8th, is in place from 11pm to 5am each night.

description: In Comoros, the National Agency for Maritime Affairs announced that all movement of people between East Africa (Kenya, Tanzania, Madagascar, Mozambique, etc…) and Comoros is strictly prohibited, from March 23rd

description: Comoros suspends all international commercial flights, with the exception of cargo flights from the 23rd of March until further notice.
Comoros, 23rd April: The Ministry of Health purchased the equipment for PCR testing.

description: Comoros closed two markets of Moroni and VoloVolo for cleaning and disinfection on 29th March 2020.

description: Comoros suspended sea travel between islands from the 19th of March until further notice. This measure particularly affects travel on board the Kwassa-Kwassa, between the four islands.

description:
Comoros suspended sea travel between islands from the 19th of March until further notice. This measure particularly affects travel on board the Kwassa-Kwassa, between the four islands.

description: Comoros is suspending all public festivities and gatherings from the 16th of March until further notice.
Comoros prohibited Friday and collective prayers in mosques from March 25th. All mosques throughout the country will remain closed until the health situation is resolved.

Comoros prohibited Friday and collective prayers in mosques from March 25th. All mosques throughout the country will remain closed until the health situation is resolved.
As of July 8th, all mosques and other places of worship are reopened. The places of ablution (hand washing, cleansing) within religious buildings will remain closed. UPDATE: As of July 8th, Mosques and other places of worships are reopened. The places of ablution (hand washing, cleansing) within religious spaces will remain closed.
On May 21st in Comoros, the Grand Mufti, or the government counsel on Islamic faith and law, has suggested that Muslims celebrate Eid al-Fitr at home during these exceptional times.
type_sub_cat: Attendance at religious services restricted (e.g. mosque/church closings)

description: Comoros is enforcing that all sporting events be played behind closed doors in all sports arenas on March 18th until further notice.
